definition: (of actors) to make up/to disguise oneself
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]
adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack

sentences.english: Do you want to go to masquerade parties?
sentences.chinese: 你想去参加化装舞会吗？

sentences.english: The actor made himself uD as an old peasant.
sentences.chinese: 这个演员把自己化装成一个老农民。

sentences.english: I wonder if there is any chance for you to come to our masquerade .
sentences.chinese: 我想请问您是否能够来参加我们的化装舞会。

sentences.english: Apply to food, medicine, cosmetics and other industries.
sentences.chinese: 适用于食品，药品，化装品等行业。

sentences.english: The parade features marchers in elaborate and expensive costumes.
sentences.chinese: 今日费城的化装游行依然保留着昔日的部分特色。

sentences.english: She dress up in Elizabethan costume for the fancy?dress ball.
sentences.chinese: 她穿上伊丽莎白一世时代的服装去参加化装舞会。

sentences.english: He went among the drug dealers in disguise.
sentences.chinese: 他化装混到毒品贩子当中。

sentences.english: Because the masquerade is originate from Italy.
sentences.chinese: 因为化装舞会起源于意大利。

sentences.english: Has Mr. de Winter not suggested anything for you?
sentences.chinese: 德温特先生没有建议您穿什么样的化装服吗？

sentences.english: Civilization is the lamb's skin in which barbarism masquerades.
sentences.chinese: 文明是野蛮在羔羊皮上的化装舞会。

sentences.english: Dressing-room was filled with the hum of enthusiasm and laughter like the neighing of horses.
sentences.chinese: 化装室一直充满兴奋的叫声和类似马嘶的笑声。

sentences.english: I dressed up as a pirate, complete with sword!
sentences.chinese: 我化装成一个海盗，还配着剑。

sentences.english: He went masked ball without masking his face.
sentences.chinese: 他去参加化装舞会而没戴假面具。

sentences.english: Could i have the 30%OFF with skincare by the coupons?
sentences.chinese: 这个化装品我可以用折扣券打30%么？

sentences.english: We will have a fancy ball tonight. Would you like to join us?
sentences.chinese: 今晚我们有一个化装舞会，你愿意参加吗？

sentences.english: Theatrical make-up and artificial blood had been used to make the injures look realistic.
sentences.chinese: 舞台化装和假血的应用使得伤口看起来很逼真。

definition: to dress up in disguise (idiom); to pretend for the purpose of deceit
to impersonate/to act the part of sb/to disguise oneself as sb else
to hunt and arrest (fugitives)/to track down and arrest/a manhunt
to fool people (idiom)/to pull the wool over people's eyes
to decorate/to dress/to make up/to adorn/manner of dressing/style of dress
(of a man) to dress as a woman (idiom)
